resources.string: How much do you know about Dinosaurs? \n \n Let\'s Find out!
True or False\: Dinosaurs are classified into subgroups based on skeletal features:
How many species of Utahraptors are known to exist?
Which of these Dinosaurs are not Carnivores?
\nDinosaur subgroups are classified by bone structure. \n With particular scrutiny given to their hips, legs, and backbones.

There is only one species of Utahraptor. 
Utahraptor ostrommaysi was found in the United States. 
While somewhat controversial, it is said they were the deadliest of dinosaurs.
\nThe largest known dinosaur is the Argentinosaurus. \nFound in South America, this giant sauropod lived in the Late Cretaceous period.
\nThe Allosaurus and Mapusaurus were both Carnosaurians which, as the name implies, means they were Carnivores. \nThe Argentinosaurus and the Diplodocus on the other hand are herbivores.
